headline_findings.title: £9.5 Million in Potential Duplicate Payments
headline_findings.description: Analysis identified same-day, same-amount payments to the same supplier. While some may be legitimate, the pattern warrants investigation.

headline_findings.title: 51 Netflix Payments on Council Cards
headline_findings.description: The council has made 51 separate payments to Netflix since 2021. While small individually, questions arise about what council business requires streaming subscriptions.
headline_findings.detail: Payments range from £8.99 to £12.99 per month, charged to Economy & Growth department

headline_findings.title: Amazon Prime Subscriptions
headline_findings.description: 51 payments to Amazon Prime, raising questions about whether personal subscription services should be on council cards.

headline_findings.title: £13,243 Spent on Facebook/Meta Advertising
headline_findings.description: Nearly 200 payments to Facebook for social media advertising. Is this the most effective use of communications budget?

headline_findings.title: £1.67 Million on Consultants
headline_findings.description: Over £1.6 million spent on external consultants. Could this expertise be developed in-house?

headline_findings.title: £21 Million to Single Outsourcing Company
headline_findings.description: Liberata UK Ltd receives £21M+ for revenues and benefits services. This single contract represents nearly 10% of all council spending.

headline_findings.title: £53,651 on Hotel Chains
headline_findings.description: Travelodge (£37,214), Premier Inn (£16,443), and Holiday Inn (£4,580) payments. Are overnight stays necessary for a local council?

headline_findings.title: £72,087 on Asylum/Refugee Services
headline_findings.description: Payments to organisations supporting asylum seekers and refugees in the borough.
